page.title: 16Badlesmere : Transport
page.content: The A25l (Ashford-Faversham) is the main road through the area. The bus service is minimal and sparsely used although constant reduction in the service heavily penalises the few who rely on it. On each weekday, 6 buses and on Saturdays, 3 buses, operate each way operated by the National Bus Company. (Single fare Ashford to Faversham Â£l.45; Return Â£2.3O). There are no buses on Sunday. Most households in this rural area have a car. Many families have two cars to allow the wife freedom to shop and transport children to and from school. Bicycles are used mainly for pleasure. There is no footpath along the busy A25l between Leaveland and Badlesmere which makes walking hazardous. Train travellers have the choice of travel from either Faversham or Charing Stn.
